home.subtitle: Creative Economy, Innovation and Territorial Development
home.aboutText: The Graduate Program in Tourism and Hospitality (PPGTURH) and the Graduate Program in Letters and Culture (PPGLET), from the University of Caxias do Sul (Brazil), CETT Barcelona School of Tourism, Hospitality and Gastronomy - University of Barcelona (Spain), the School of Management, Hospitality and Tourism (Portugal) and the University of Groningen (Netherlands) are pleased to announce the III International Conference on Literary and Film Tourism, to be held in Caxias do Sul (Brazil) on March 26-27, 2026. The event brings together researchers, professionals and students interested in exploring the intersections between literature, cinema, tourism and territorial development. Focusing on the creative economy and innovation, it will be a space for debate and exchange of international experiences.

call.title: Call for Papers
call.description: Submit your research for presentation at the conference
call.guidelinesText: The III International Conference on Literary and Film Tourism explores the theme Creative Economy, Innovation and Territorial Development in the context of Literary Tourism and Film Tourism. We invite researchers, tourism professionals, managers, graduate and undergraduate students from different areas to present their research work. Authors can present an individual paper or a panel proposal. The instructions for participating in each of these two modalities are as follows:
call.individualDescription:
Instructions for Paper Submission

Dear candidate,

To submit your paper, please follow the instructions below carefully:

Thematic line number: Select the thematic line that best fits your proposal. This number must correspond to the theme of your work.

Paper title: Provide the complete title of your paper.

Abstract (up to 300 words): In the abstract field, include:

Paper title

Research objectives

Methodology used

Results obtained

Conclusions

Authors and affiliations: Provide the full names of all authors, including their institutional affiliations (university, company or institution).

References: List 3 to 5 bibliographic references used in preparing the paper.

Keywords: Choose 3 to 5 keywords that represent the content of your paper, separated by commas.

Language: Select the language in which your paper was written.

Attachments (optional): If desired, you can attach additional files, such as figures, tables or supplementary documents.

After completing the form and submitting, you will automatically receive a copy containing all the information that was submitted.

Important: Before submitting, review all fields to ensure that all information is correct and complete. Incomplete or non-standard papers may be disregarded.
call.panelDescription: Each panel will consist of a minimum of 4 papers and a maximum of 6 papers on a common theme. Panels will have a maximum duration of two hours. The panel coordinator must submit a document with the following information: the panel title, a 300-word abstract, a list of five to ten references, and the list of authors and affiliations of panel members participating in the panel. Each panel member must register individually.
